1.1.20  8:12 am   Hey i have a huge history test with 17 chapters
Can you give me some tip on memorization that can help me?

Â Â Â Â Â i unfortunately have no memorization tips. my memorization is good, over time, but it goes at its own pace. i've always been strong with reading ability and been able to sneak by with reading materials. that being said, i don't think reading was explicitly disallowed on any of those situations. in your situation reading might not be allowed. and i regret to say that i have no strategies for you. time is the only thing i know of, and the same is true from almost all other people from music/acting professions i have consulted on this issue

1.1.20  2:05 am   12.31.19  6:03 pm this is so interesting. I am wondering tho, what does the 36, -1, (\d|\D)(?=,), and x%n% mean? so interesting

Â Â Â Â Â 36 is the range of the random number picked. has to be between 0 and 35. it's going to be converted to letters/numbers. so that's how many choices there are (26 letters, and 10 numbers). the '-1' means you start the variable "n" at -1. the (\d|\D)(?=,) is regex to search for every letter/number with a comma after. the x%n% means literally the letter x followed by whatever value n currently is. so if n is 5 then x%n% would be x5
